title: Unable to restore or sync Bookmarks
content:
I formatted my HDD and reinstalled windows 10 pro again on same HDD and system. After installing firefox and loggin into my account everything got synced except Bookmarks. For safety i had taken backup of my old firefox installation profile folders.

However i tried to sync and also replace bookmarks file from old to new, but none of the things are working for me. In my last installation there is no file named places.sqlite but same is created in new which is causing my bookmarks not to load.

Please note that usually all my bookmarks was automatically backed up to my account and it used to restore back again automatically without the need to take extra backup. But this time my sync was unable to restore my bookmarks.

When i am trying to click options like import bookmark from HTML or Restore Bookmark from my backup file, sadly there is no action after clicking on relevant buttons. It is not just opening the dialog box for me to select file to restore the bookmark.

I tried all options at my end but of no use. Please help as there is bug which doesnt open bookmark restore or import bookmark from other file
creator: ruzveh

title: Самовольное обновление (перезагрузка) вкладок.
content: Добрый день. В процессе использования браузера, вкладки самовольно перезагружаются. Играю в браузерную игру и ни с того ни с сего вкладка сама по себе перезагружается, выкидывая меня из игры. Это происходит по непонятным причинам. В настройках я отключил автообновление вкладок (about:config - accessibility.blockautorefresh: - true). Там стояло значение false. Но вкладки все равно обновляются без моего участия. Это происходит на всех моих профилях в Фаерфокс. Как это остановить? Это мешает мне пользоваться браузером и комфортно играть.

title: Website Loading Issues – Possibly Related to Firefox Update
content:
Dear Firefox/Mozilla Support Team,

I am writing to report a persistent issue that started occurring last week. Since then, I have been unable to properly load several websites, including WeTransfer, YouTube, ChatGPT, and some others. These pages either don’t load at all or are extremely slow and unresponsive.

While this problem started around the time I updated Firefox, I’m not entirely sure if it is directly related to the update itself. I have already tried clearing my cache and cookies, restarting the browser, and disabling all extensions, but the issue still persists.

These websites are essential for my daily tasks, and this situation is significantly disrupting my work. I would really appreciate it if you could investigate the issue and let me know if there is a known fix or any recommended steps to resolve it.

Thank you very much in advance for your assistance.

Best regards, Darja.
creator: darja.tibaot

title: Could you please make your sync function work properly?
content:

Toolbars don't sync -- I know, for some reason that's "by design" (or laziness?) -- Settings don't really sync much (maybe a few do when the moons of Jupiter and Uranus are in perfect alignment).

Could you maybe consider syncing the various exception lists in the Settings?

title: Very annoying process to report bugs
content:

title: Setting "hot keys" for Firefox Screenshot downloading
content:
Sometimes, when I want to use the Take a Screenshot function (on my toolbar) to save a long section of a page, after selecting what I want and scrolling down to the Download button, the process positions the page's floating 'identification' bar across the the middle of the picture. Is there a way to set a keyboard shortcut to trigger the download command after making the selection, without the need to scroll down to see the button? This would greatly simplify the process. In some limited searching and testing, I haven't found anything that accomplishes this.

I have attached a screenshot of a page to serve as an example of how the bar is superimposed.

FWIW, this system is still running Windows 7, Firefox 115.22.0 esr.

title: "this site could be risky" potential threat detected mozilla firefox message
content:
Hi there,

hopefully We can fix this specific and relevant problem.

Many Clients texted me complaining over connectivity and access problem to johnfante.org web site.

They get a message "this site could be risky" potential threat detected (view in the screenshot) or generic ssl error on the screen (ssl certificate screenshot from browser console).

The fact is that We, as a Host, and the Webmaster too, both checked web site many times and the code is clean and the SSL certificate is active and it's working out.

I have no problems to access & connect to web site in Google Chrome whatsoever, but the access is barred with firefox.

Please please I've got many messages from my clients this term, They're complaining over "security" messages or SSL problem with Firefox.

Is there a solution? Are You working actively on a fix? Or, most importantly, is there a work around solution that I can give to my clients?

Thanks for your help...

title: Secure Form is blocked
content:
I regularly receive email advice (via Thunderbird) from companies to access my account with them.

Two days ago I selected a link to direct me to the secure form. I note that the exact same link has been provided to me in the past and opened. This time however I was confronted with "Invalid Address".

I was advised to copy the link into another browser; I chose "Edge" and the form opened.

I have cleared FireFox's "Recent History" but that still gives no joy.

How do I overcome this?

Is there something in a configuration file that I might edit, or a potentially corrupt Windows Registry entry?

I do not use any Windows Security depending upon Bitdefender (which has never created any issues of this nature).

title: Unable To Reply On Threads Social Media
content: Hi there team! Since a Mozilla upgrade earlier this year, I have been unable to create a reply to certain posts made by folks I follow on Threads social media. It occurs about 20% of the time, intermittently yet consistently. When I seek to create a reply, the response window opens with a restricted field that does not allow me to enter any text. Please see the attached screen shot. It's just a box with no cursor. The restriction has never occurred when I'm on Edge or Chrome, only on Firefox. But I prefer Firefox. I am a senior who uses an IBM-clone desktop running Windows10 (contemplating Win11, but that's another story). I use standard Mozilla security settings for browser privacy. Firefox browser is current. I have attempted shutting down all ad blockers in isolation and in combinations attempting to rectify with no results. I am guessing I possibly have some setting out of whack, but I have no clue what this is called or how to fix this. Not a major issue but a continual annoyance and a puzzlement. Am I the only person who has this problem? Is it a Threads issue perhaps? (their help is non-existent). However the issue does not occur when I use Threads on my Android phone, and it has never occurred on Bluesky, Reddit, Facebook, YouTube or any other platform I access. Can anyone help figure this out please? Thank you! Regards, Lorraine the Inkenheimer Lorraine@inkenheimer.com
creator: Lorraine4
